documents.title: The open source AI coding agent
documents.description: OpenCode - The open source coding agent.
documents.summary: OpenCode is an open-source AI coding agent that integrates with various LLM providers and development environments to assist with coding while prioritizing data privacy.

documents.title: Intro
documents.description: Get started with OpenCode.
documents.summary: This document provides a comprehensive walkthrough for getting started with OpenCode, covering installation across various platforms, LLM provider configuration, and core usage workflows.

documents.title: Enterprise
documents.description: Using OpenCode securely in your organization.
documents.summary: This document provides an overview of security, deployment, and configuration options for implementing OpenCode within an enterprise environment, focusing on data privacy and internal infrastructure integration.

documents.title: Config
documents.description: Using the OpenCode JSON config.
documents.summary: This document provides a comprehensive guide to configuring OpenCode using JSON or JSONC files, explaining file locations, precedence rules, and specific setting options.

documents.title: Network
documents.description: Configure proxies and custom certificates.
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure proxy settings and custom CA certificates for OpenCode in enterprise network environments. It covers environment variables, authentication, and trust configurations for secure connections.

documents.title: Providers
documents.description: Using any LLM provider in OpenCode.
documents.summary: This document provides instructions for connecting and configuring various Large Language Model (LLM) providers with OpenCode through authentication, API keys, and environment variables.

documents.title: Windows (WSL)
documents.description: Run OpenCode on Windows using WSL for the best experience.
documents.summary: This document provides instructions for installing and running OpenCode on Windows using WSL to ensure better performance and seamless integration with Linux-based features.

documents.title: CLI
documents.description: OpenCode CLI options and commands.
documents.summary: This document provides a comprehensive technical reference for the OpenCode CLI, detailing available commands, flags, and programmatic interaction methods. It covers session management, agent configuration, model provider authentication, and the terminal user interface.

documents.title: Troubleshooting
documents.description: Common issues and how to resolve them.
documents.summary: This document provides comprehensive troubleshooting steps and diagnostic procedures for resolving technical issues with OpenCode and its desktop application. It covers log file locations, plugin management, cache clearing, and platform-specific fixes for macOS, Linux, and Windows.

documents.title: TUI
documents.description: Using the OpenCode terminal user interface.
documents.summary: This document provides a comprehensive guide on using the OpenCode terminal user interface (TUI), detailing its commands, file referencing system, shell integration, and customization settings.

documents.title: IDE
documents.description: The OpenCode extension for VS Code, Cursor, and other IDEs
documents.summary: This document outlines the installation process, usage shortcuts, and troubleshooting steps for integrating OpenCode into VS Code and other supported IDEs.

documents.title: Zen
documents.description: Curated list of models provided by OpenCode.
documents.summary: OpenCode Zen is a curated AI gateway providing access to verified coding models through a unified API and billing system. The document details model endpoints, configuration steps, pricing per token, and data privacy policies.

documents.title: Web
documents.description: Using OpenCode in your browser.
documents.summary: This guide explains how to launch and configure the OpenCode web interface for browser-based AI coding. It covers server setup, networking options like mDNS and CORS, authentication, and managing coding sessions.

documents.title: GitHub
documents.description: Use OpenCode in GitHub issues and pull-requests.
documents.summary: This document provides comprehensive instructions for installing, configuring, and using OpenCode to automate GitHub tasks like issue triaging and code reviews via GitHub Actions.

documents.title: Share
documents.description: Share your OpenCode conversations.
documents.summary: This document explains how to use OpenCode's share feature to create and manage public links for collaborative conversations. It details the different sharing modes, configuration options, and privacy considerations for users and enterprises.

documents.title: Rules
documents.description: Set custom instructions for opencode.
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure custom instructions and rules for opencode using AGENTS.md files, global settings, and external references to tailor LLM behavior.

documents.title: Tools
documents.description: Manage the tools an LLM can use.
documents.summary: This document describes the built-in and custom tools available in OpenCode for LLM-driven codebase interaction and provides instructions for managing their execution permissions. It serves as a comprehensive reference for file manipulation, shell execution, and external service integration via MCP servers.

documents.title: GitLab
documents.description: Use OpenCode in GitLab issues and merge requests.
documents.summary: This document explains how to integrate OpenCode into GitLab workflows using CI/CD pipelines and GitLab Duo to automate tasks like issue triage and merge request reviews.

documents.title: Keybinds
documents.description: Customize your keybinds.
documents.summary: This configuration file defines the default keyboard shortcuts and keybindings for the OpenCode AI platform, covering session management, input editing, and UI navigation.

documents.title: Agents
documents.description: Configure and use specialized agents.
documents.summary: This document explains the types, usage, and configuration of OpenCode agents, which are specialized AI assistants that can be customized for specific development workflows and tasks.

documents.title: Models
documents.description: Configuring an LLM provider and model.
documents.summary: This document explains how to select, configure, and manage LLM providers and models within OpenCode, including setting defaults and custom variants. It details the process of modifying the configuration file to control model behavior and loading priority.

documents.title: ACP Support
documents.description: Use OpenCode in any ACP-compatible editor.
documents.summary: This document explains how to integrate OpenCode into ACP-compatible editors and IDEs to enable AI coding features through standardized protocols.

documents.title: Formatters
documents.description: OpenCode uses language specific formatters.
documents.summary: This document explains how OpenCode automatically formats source code using language-specific tools and provides instructions for configuring, disabling, or customizing these formatters.

documents.title: SDK
documents.description: Type-safe JS client for opencode server.
documents.summary: This document provides a comprehensive guide and API reference for the opencode JS/TS SDK, detailing installation, client configuration, and the usage of type-safe server endpoints. It explains how to manage sessions, handle errors, and implement structured JSON output using JSON schemas.

documents.title: Agent Skills
documents.description: Define reusable behavior via SKILL.md definitions
documents.summary: This document explains how to define and manage reusable agent behaviors using SKILL.md files within the OpenCode ecosystem. It covers directory structures, metadata formatting, permission configurations, and discovery mechanics for automated skills.

documents.title: Server
documents.description: Interact with opencode server over HTTP.
documents.summary: This document explains how to run and configure the opencode headless HTTP server and provides a comprehensive reference for its OpenAPI-based REST endpoints.

documents.title: Plugins
documents.description: Write your own plugins to extend OpenCode.
documents.summary: This document provides a comprehensive guide on extending OpenCode through plugins, covering installation methods, development structure, available event hooks, and implementation examples.

documents.title: Commands
documents.description: Create custom commands for repetitive tasks.
documents.summary: This document provides instructions for creating and configuring custom commands in the OpenCode TUI to automate repetitive tasks using either Markdown or JSON files. It explains how to use prompt templates, handle arguments, and integrate shell command outputs into custom workflows.

documents.title: Themes
documents.description: Select a built-in theme or define your own.
documents.summary: This document explains how to select, configure, and create custom visual themes in OpenCode, including technical requirements for truecolor support. It covers built-in options, the adaptive system theme, and the JSON-based hierarchy for custom theme definitions.

documents.title: Custom Tools
documents.description: Create tools the LLM can call in opencode.
documents.summary: This document explains how to create and configure custom tools for opencode using TypeScript or JavaScript to extend LLM capabilities. It covers tool definitions, argument validation using Zod, and methods for integrating scripts from other languages.

documents.title: MCP servers
documents.description: Add local and remote MCP tools.
documents.summary: This document explains how to integrate and configure local and remote Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers within OpenCode to extend LLM capabilities with external tools.

documents.title: Ecosystem
documents.description: Projects and integrations built with OpenCode.
documents.summary: This document provides a curated directory of community-developed plugins, projects, and agents that extend the functionality of the OpenCode ecosystem. It serves as a resource for finding integrations, developer tools, and specialized AI workflows built by the community.

documents.title: LSP Servers
documents.description: OpenCode integrates with your LSP servers.
documents.summary: This document explains how OpenCode integrates with Language Server Protocol (LSP) servers to provide codebase diagnostics and feedback. It details the list of built-in servers, automatic detection logic, and comprehensive configuration options for customizing or adding new LSP servers.

documents.title: Permissions
documents.description: Control which actions require approval to run.
documents.summary: This document explains how to configure action permissions in OpenCode to control tool execution through allow, ask, and deny rules. It covers granular configuration syntax, wildcard matching, default security behaviors, and agent-specific permission overrides.
